Description: 13 beads of different shape and material and one spacer. A: Spacer-bead made of red faience, six segments preserved, very eroded on all sides, parts chipped off. B: Bead in an elongated shape with a thickened end, the other end is broken off. Made of a paste material, faience or frit (?) in a greyish-bluish colour. C: Complete cylindrical bead made of white faience, with rounded edges at the end. D: Three flattened spherical beads made of well glazed shiny faience in a pearlescent colour. Two slightly smaller than the third one. E: One cylindrical segmented bead, three segments preserved, one broken off though, made of faience, no colour preserved. F: Seven disc-shaped beads in slightly varying sizes, the colour differs from blue to light green to whitish.
Acquisition notes: Formerly housed by the Birmingham Museum and Art Gallery and the EES London.
